message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Need to analyze the trend of the U.S. federal government spending and deficit before and after the pandemic. Please provide me with the following data through fiscal years 2015-2024: the federal Budget (trillion), the federal spending (trillion), the federal deficit (trillion), the national debt (trillion), and the net interest cost on the gross federal debt (trillion).

Please organize the results in one Markdown table with the following column names in order: 
Fiscal Year, Federal Budget, Federal Spending, Federal Deficit, National Debt, Net Interest Cost.
 
Under the Fiscal Year, state the statistics like FY2015, FY2016.

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```?

<think>
To start, I need to gather the data for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2024 for the federal budget, spending, deficit, national debt, and net interest cost on the gross federal debt. I'll begin by searching for this data.
</think>

<search> U.S. federal government spending and deficit data from 2015 to 2024 </search>

Search query: U.S. federal government spending and deficit data from 2015 to 2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/national-deficit/):
National Deficit | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data Compared to the national deficit of $624 billion for the same period last year (Oct 2024 - Nov 2024), our national deficit has decreased by $167 billion.

[Doc 2](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/report/deficit-tracker/):
Deficit Tracker - Bipartisan Policy Center The federal government's deficit in fiscal year 2025 was $1.8 trillion—4% lower than last year's after adjusting for timing effects. Revenues increased by 6%, ...

[Doc 3](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/federal-spending/):
Federal Spending | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data Compared to the federal spending of $1.25 trillion for the same period last year (Oct 2024 - Nov 2024) our federal spending has decreased by $55 billion.

It seems the most detailed source provided is the U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data. I will use that link to get the necessary data.

<search> U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data from 2015 to 2024 </search>

Search query: U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data from 2015 to 2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/datasets/monthly-treasury-statement/):
Monthly Treasury Statement (MTS) - Fiscal Data This dataset contains a monthly summary of the federal government's receipts and outlays, as well as the resulting surpluses and deficits.

[Doc 2](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/datasets/daily-treasury-statement/):
Daily Treasury Statement (DTS) - Fiscal Data The Daily Treasury Statement (DTS) dataset contains a series of tables showing the daily cash and debt operations of the US Treasury.

[Doc 3](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/):
U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data With historical and current data, Fiscal Data is your hub for fiscal data. Download datasets on topics such as debt, interest rates, and more.
